Entry.Name: SLOTH
Entry.Description: Due to the support for RSA-MD5 certificate signature, TLS 1.2 is prone to a series of transcript collision attacks. If a client uses the same certificate to authenticate with different servers, an attacker can force the victim to create a signature that can be used to impersonate it.

Mitigation.Textual: Update the TLS library to a version that contains the custom mitigations (e.g. OpenSSL v1.0.1f+).
